name: num::nonzero::NonZero::<usize>::midpoint

num::nonzero::NonZero::<T>::get.doc: Returns the contained value as a primitive type.

num::<impl usize>::midpoint.doc:
Calculates the midpoint (average) between `self` and `rhs`.

 `midpoint(a, b)` is `(a + b) / 2` as if it were performed in a
 sufficiently-large unsigned integral type. This implies that the result is
 always rounded towards zero and that no overflow will ever occur.

 # Examples

 ```
 ```

num::nonzero::NonZero::<T>::new_unchecke.doc:
Creates a non-zero without checking whether the value is non-zero.
 This results in undefined behavior if the value is zero.

 # Safety

 The value must not be zero.
